etymologies: mid 17th century (in the sense ‘clean out (dirt)’): back-formation from scavenger

definitions: search for and collect (anything usable) from discarded waste

examples.text: people sell junk scavenged from the garbage
the city dump where the squatters scavenge to survive

shortDefinitions: search for and collect anything usable from discarded waste

definitions: (of an animal) search for (carrion) as food.
shortDefinitions: (of animal) search for carrion as food

definitions: search for discarded items or food in (a place)

examples.text: the mink is still commonly seen scavenging the beaches of California

shortDefinitions: search for discarded items or food in

definitions: remove (combustion products) from the cylinder of an internal combustion engine on the return stroke of the piston.
shortDefinitions: remove combustion products from cylinder of internal combustion engine on return stroke of piston

definitions: combine with and remove (molecules, groups, etc.) from a particular medium

examples.text: chlorine molecules can scavenge ozone at a very fast rate

shortDefinitions: combine with and remove (molecules, groups, etc.) from particular medium
